page.title: 19Local People in the News
page.content: Recently, helped by friends Phil Warner and Jeff Hunton,{Paul {Rutherford}of Church Lane, Wrecclesham hurtled across the waves at 70 mph to win the London Docklands Channel Race in a new{power boat.}The boat{"Puffa" cost Â£40,000 - half of which went on the special engines which do only a mile and a half per gallon of petrol. { Neil Boyd}of Burls Farm, Dippenhall, was slightly hurt on Thursday 18 July when a deer ran out in front of the car in which he was travelling. { Jean Dewing}of Shortheath Road won a bottle of whisky after achieving a hole in one at Worplesdon Golf Club. { Paul Gill,}manager of Unigate's milk Depot in Weydon Lane went on the rounds himself in July when his firm was hit by a shortage of milkmen. { David Lloyd}scored 60 runs as Weydon cricket team won the S.W.Surrey Cup.
